On Monday 18 May 2009, Bob Haugen wrote:
> Code-on-demand (e.g. javascript) is part of ReST.
>
> The server can send all of the logic required as javascript on
> initial load, or event-driven as json, or however you want to do it.

Yes, I mentioned logic on the client. Probably I shouldn't have. The 
problem I've described is not resolved by adding more logic anywhere, it 
depends on state. The logic needs some data to chew on. If the relevant 
logic is on the client, somehow the data has to get there too.
